param.name: osuser
param.description: The username of the designated OS user. This user must be local administrator and have the correct regional settings

param.name: ospassword
param.description: The password of the designated OS user

param.name: projectsuffix
param.description: Whenever more than one project is installed, the projectsuffix indicates the project

param.name: connectstring
param.description: The connectstring for the database

param.name: databasetype
param.description: Is the database an oracle or sqlserver database?

param.name: apppath
param.description: The path of the folder in which the application folder is created

param.name: webpath
param.description: The path of the folder in which the website folder is created

param.name: datapath
param.description: The path of the folder in which the data folder is created. For example when the datapath is 'c:\InfoShare' the logs will be created in the folder 'c:\InfoShare\Data\Logs.'

param.name: workspacepath
param.description: The path is a tempory folder in which all the folders and files are copied and modified before the actual installation

param.name: infoshareauthorwebappname
param.description: The name of the Content Manager website

param.name: infosharewswebappname
param.description: The name of the website for Content Manager webservices

param.name: infosharestswebappname
param.description: The name of the website with the Content Manager Secure Token Service

param.name: websitename
param.description: The name of the Web Site, where all virtual directories will be created in

param.name: baseurl
param.description: Indicates the first part of the URL your InfoShare users will need to browse to use it. Most of the time a machine like http://TRILT11/ will do, however some situations require specific naming. A full dns name indicating the use of SSL might be required, like https://TRIDT06.tribe.trisoft.be).

param.name: ps_fo_processor
param.description: The full file path to an xsl fo processor which uses the same command line options as AntennaHouse XSLFormatter. This allows you to indicate your path and possibly switch between compatible versions. Note: do not use environment variables or qoute your file path.

param.name: ps_htmlhelp_processor
param.description: The full file path to an html help processor which uses the same command line options as Microsoft HTML Help Workshop. This allows you to indicate your path and possibly switch between compatible versions. Note: do not use environment variables or qoute your file path.

param.name: ps_java_home
param.description: The full path to a JAVA HOME folder. This allows you to indicate your path and possibly switch between compatible versions. See documentation for the version we tested against. Note: do not use environment variables or qoute your file path.

param.name: ps_javahelp_home
param.description: The full path to a JavaHelp JHHOME folder. This allows you to set the JavaHelp Home folder when you want to publish with type JavaHelp. Note: do not use environment variables or qoute your file path.

param.name: ps_webworks_automap_application
param.description: The full path to WebWorks Application

param.name: solrlucene_service_port
param.description: The port used by the SolrLucene service. Make sure this is an unique port per project.

param.name: solrlucene_stop_port
param.description: The port used to stop the SolrLucene service. Make sure this is an unique port per project.

param.name: localservicehostname
param.description: Indicates the local service hostname part of the base URL. This can be localhost or the machine name (TRIDT06). It will be used by all service side components that access the WCF Services on the same box.

param.name: servicecertificatethumbprint
param.description: Specify the thumbprint of an already installed certificate (e.g. A43489159A520F0D93D032CCAF37E7FE20A8B419) for unique service identification. You can repurpose your SSL certificate. Note that all your linked web/app servers in a farm should offer the same trusted certificate.

param.name: servicecertificatevalidationmode
param.description: The validation mode specified here will decide how the application to application communication validates service certificates. The allowed options are: ChainTrust, PeerTrust, PeerOrChainTrust or None. By setting the mode to None, any certificate will be accepted.

param.name: issuercertificatethumbprint
param.description: Specify thumbprint of the certificate of the Secure Token Service (e.g. A43489159A520F0D93D032CCAF37E7FE20A8B419) for unique service identification. Notice that it has to be uppercased, no-whitespace and should never contain unicode characters. Optionally for the built-in STS you can repurpose the thumbprint of your SSL certificate.

param.name: issuercertificatevalidationmode
param.description: The validation mode specified here will decide how the application to application communication validates service certificates. The allowed options are: ChainTrust, PeerTrust, PeerOrChainTrust or None. By setting the mode to None, any certificate will be accepted.

param.name: issuerwstrustbindingtype
param.description: Specify the binding type that is required by the end point of the WS-Trust issuer. Two valid binding types are UserNameMixed and WindowsMixed. When specifying UserNameMixed the matching input parameters issueractorusername and issueractorpassword must be set. When specifying WindowsMixed the matching input parameters issueractorusername and issueractorpassword must be empty as the principal of the service user (osuser) will be used as credentials.

param.name: issueractorusername
param.description: When an application must delegate the incoming claim set to another application; the acting application must have a valid username to request a token delegation.

param.name: issueractorpassword
param.description: When an application must delegate the incoming claim set to another application; the acting application must have a valid password to request a token delegation.

param.name: issuerwstrustendpointurl
param.description: The WS-Trust endpoint for the Security Token Service that provides the functionality to issue tokens as specified by the issuerwstrustbindingtype. When using the built-in STS, use the value of BASEURL/INFOSHARESTSWEBAPPNAME/issue/wstrust/mixed/username when issuerwstrustbindingtype is UserNameMixed resulting in for example https://example.com/ISHSTS/issue/wstrust/mixed/username or when issuerwstrustbindingtype is WindowsMixed use the value of BASEURL/INFOSHARESTSWEBAPPNAME/issue/wstrust/mixed/windows.

param.name: issuerwstrustmexurl
param.description: The WS-Trust metadata address for the Security Token Service. Optionally when using the built-in STS you should use the value of BASEURL/INFOSHARESTSWEBAPPNAME/issue/wstrust/mex resulting in for example https://example.com/ISHSTS/issue/wstrust/mex

param.name: issuerwsfederationendpointurl
param.description: The WS-Federation endpoint for the Security Token Service that provides the functionality to issue tokens for browsers (Passive Profile). Optionally when using the built-in STS you should use the value of BASEURL/INFOSHARESTSWEBAPPNAME/issue/wsfed resulting in for example https://example.com/ISHSTS/issue/wsfed

param.name: serviceusername
param.description: Any service requesting automated access to the system will use this account.

param.name: servicepassword
param.description: Any service requesting automated access to the system will use this account.
